showerReviews.reviewText: The manager Ms. Camp and all of the staff at this location are amazing.  They made the process of making a reservation, checking-in, and the entire stay pleasant.  The hotel is very clean! Everyone is so accommodating and friendly. …

This was a nice hotel to stay in for a night. The rooms were clean. I got some chocolate as a welcome gift. The Wi-Fi was fast.  Everything was clean, and the staff was courteous and friendly. Good location and convenient, close to the airport.

Very nice place. Rooms were clean and nice. The bar was convenient, and the servers were a lot of fun. Nice pool.
Seems they have some organizational issues to iron out. They got our bill mixed up with someone else's, and they don't serve coffee in the lobby on Sunday mornings.

""8/102 weeks ago on Priceline New +""  -I did not have someone cleaned my room until the day I was leaving.They need to do better instead of waiting for me to go to reception and request to have the room clean.I made sure the do not disturb sign wasn’t posted but no service.

showerReviews.reviewText: Rooms are starting to look a bit worn down, not that same fresh, new, clean feeling it had when I started staying years ago. Gym is way too small for the hotel size, and very often doesn't accommodate the amount of folks looking to use it …

I always suggest this hotel when I have colleagues in town, visiting for leisure or business. The location itself and surrounding area have improved significantly in recent years. The view from the hotel is great too. Always enough parking in the attached ramp. Rooms are clean and reasonably well-appointed.

I was quite disappointed with the cleanliness of the bathroom during my stay. It clearly hadn’t been cleaned thoroughly—there were visible stains and the overall hygiene was not up to Marriott standards. I expected better attention to detail and cleanliness from a brand like Marriott. Hope this can be improved for future guests.

Room was lovely, spacious. Staff is top-notch: professional,  friendly, helpful. Only downside is deeper clean in roo s needed, e.g., lamp shades so dusty... Need room give housekeeping staff more time to do through cleaning.

showerReviews.reviewText: … On-site washroom.and shower facilities were clean and easy to access and use. …

… If you plan to take a shower before changing back to dry clothes, there are only two shower stalls inside the restroom/locker room. Additionally, you should bring your supplies like soap & shampoo. …

… the summer except now it was freezing cold air making those areas even colder. I also wish they forced people to shower as I saw 90% of the people not shower.  And I also wish they had a better system for people walking through in there …

… wait line for a slide! Hot tubs were both full and small. No chairs left, tiny over priced locker that most people struggle with. No room to swim. Not even much soap in the shower area. I wanted to leave, no refunds! What a waste of money!

… are wearing their t-shirt or underwear shirt during swimming, SHOULD NOT ACCEPT ANY GUESTS ENTERING THE WATERPARK WITHOUT TAKING A SHOWER AT LEAST and wear proper swimming suits for men and women. It’s soooooo disgusting experience 👎👎👎👎👎 …

… washroom and change room was clean and there are staffs which constantly keeps cleaning and mopping the floors. When we went one of the showers were broken so there's quite a line up with only 1 working shower in the ladies' change room.

… blast. Admission included complementary towel services. Water was warm. The only disadvantage is about limited shower. There is only 2 showers in the female change room which is not enough for that huge park. There is no family change room.
Really worth bringing your kids. Water is warm enough and they have an awesome structure to host their guests, including hot shower, towels, soap, etc.
… There should be more shower rooms though, the waiting time was long to use the showers. Two rooms not enough when it's full.
… There are just 2 private shower for women those for busy weekends are nothing! You can bring your own food and drink …

showerReviews.reviewText: … I really can't convey just how nice it is to walk inside and when you see the large bathrooms and shower facilities, the wonderful seating area for relaxing. It's just inviting.

After packing up our apartment and two days down the road on our cross country move, we were searching desperately for a rest stop with showers open to the public. We finally found a review (of a different truck stop) mentioning the Flying …

I came here on a Thursday evening just to use the shower facilities. We originally went to the Husky travel center in Saint Catherine's because it was closest, but they wouldn't allow showers for anyone other than truck drivers. We have …

I just wanted to share with all of you this remarkable experience in this travel Center , today 10/23/20 I was waiting for a shower . The cleaning person was out for lunch and guess what the manager saw me standing around waiting for a …

Lots of parking, very clean restrooms and shower rooms. They got that new coffee machine, bean to cup, awesome coffee. I actually like it more than Tim Hortons 😉.  This Flying J is my favorite stop before crossing to the USA and after …
Wait for shower was rather too long..plus they have no email system so if you want Ace only fax..staff were not very friendly..all in all needs improvement

… diesel islands. Clean. Loads of parking spaces. Great food and fast friendly service. The washrooms and shower facilities,  are also well maintained. I highly recommend this location. By the way... I had the chicken tenders... Mmm, mmm, …

… only problem I have with this flying j is you can't brush your teeth. You can wash your hands take a shower but you can't brush your teeth cause people are complaining. I ask for a shower stall but nope they are reserved for showers only. …
Great service, shower is roomy and very clean. Lounge is spacious.

showerReviews.reviewText: … you are five feet deep, you can see the sand and your feet down below. There is a shower on the beach to rinse the sand off yourself once you're done swimming.  In the cooler weather and in the summer,  the pier is a lovely place to walk. …

Fun, Life guards until 6 or 7. Clean, great view at sunset. Grills in the park, you can walk the pier , park for children. Volley ball set up.  Bathrooms.  Outdoor shower (to rinse off not bathe 🤢🤮) …

… . Plenty of events are Held there as well.. shootout competitions, fights - 20..30...40+ people strong! Wow !!, car shows, etc. Terrible place to shower though. Which if you ask me, is a direct attack from the city aimed at the working man.
Clean beach with life guards. It was fun with friends. The portable toilets were clean but they had no changing rooms or a place to take a quick shower.

The overall experience was pretty well. The room was clean and they were changing the towels every day. We went in November and the weather was very cold but in our room we had a heater which was working well. Sometimes it was even too hot …

The pool is overly crowded. They really should require members to make appointments to go in so it’s not crowded all the time. I ran into a male maintenance person when I walked out of the shower in women locker room. That was a terrible experience and they did not make any announcements ahead.

showerReviews.reviewText: … you are five feet deep, you can see the sand and your feet down below. There is a shower on the beach to rinse the sand off yourself once you're done swimming.  In the cooler weather and in the summer,  the pier is a lovely place to walk. …

Fun, Life guards until 6 or 7. Clean, great view at sunset. Grills in the park, you can walk the pier , park for children. Volley ball set up.  Bathrooms.  Outdoor shower (to rinse off not bathe 🤢🤮) …

… . Plenty of events are Held there as well.. shootout competitions, fights - 20..30...40+ people strong! Wow !!, car shows, etc. Terrible place to shower though. Which if you ask me, is a direct attack from the city aimed at the working man.
Clean beach with life guards. It was fun with friends. The portable toilets were clean but they had no changing rooms or a place to take a quick shower.
Beach looks nice but seems to have something built up just to get into water ???? Need shower after should be wash station in area

showerReviews.reviewText: … you are five feet deep, you can see the sand and your feet down below. There is a shower on the beach to rinse the sand off yourself once you're done swimming.  In the cooler weather and in the summer,  the pier is a lovely place to walk. …

Fun, Life guards until 6 or 7. Clean, great view at sunset. Grills in the park, you can walk the pier , park for children. Volley ball set up.  Bathrooms.  Outdoor shower (to rinse off not bathe 🤢🤮) …

… . Plenty of events are Held there as well.. shootout competitions, fights - 20..30...40+ people strong! Wow !!, car shows, etc. Terrible place to shower though. Which if you ask me, is a direct attack from the city aimed at the working man.
Clean beach with life guards. It was fun with friends. The portable toilets were clean but they had no changing rooms or a place to take a quick shower.
Beach looks nice but seems to have something built up just to get into water ???? Need shower after should be wash station in area

locations.content: Vanderbilt YMCA may offer shower facilities. Contact directly to confirm availability and pricing.

showerReviews.reviewText: This review is about YMCA summer CAMP at the Vanderbilt location. Our experience was -very- ba, with broken promises of field trips, camp counselors who did little more than day care, and limited facilities. …

I stayed 4 nights. Great dorm like accommodations. The rooms are small but sufficient. Has A/C, fridge, HD cable TV, comfortable bed.  The shower/restroom was ALWAYS clean.  Washer & dryers very convenient and appreciated. Front desk …

The overall experience was pretty well. The room was clean and they were changing the towels every day. We went in November and the weather was very cold but in our room we had a heater which was working well. Sometimes it was even too hot …

The pool is overly crowded. They really should require members to make appointments to go in so it’s not crowded all the time. I ran into a male maintenance person when I walked out of the shower in women locker room. That was a terrible experience and they did not make any announcements ahead.
